name: Intro
_source: s;Luther;The Morrissey family has spent centuries building and protecting this castle.
s;Luther;It's fortunate that Lord Morrissey allowed our entry.
s;Vincent;Do you think he'll hear us out?
s;Vincent;I've heard House Morrissey rarely deploys its troops...
s;Vincent;So it might be a tough sell getting help retaking our home.
s;Simon;I'm not sure.{w}{br}But we need his support.
s;Simon;This is probably the strongest standing noble house.
s;Simon;All of my father's old allies have fallen into ruin...
s;Juliet;Morrissey probably has an interest in keeping the noble houses around.
s;Luther;You should also make the case for what we offer to him.
s;Luther;House Verstadt may not have the same power as House Morrissey...
s;Luther;But we safeguarded a key road leading to the capital.
s;Luther;This may appeal to House Morrissey's focus on trade.
s;Simon;This has given me a lot to think about.
s;Simon;I'll see if I can find Lord Morrissey.{w}{br}Wish me luck.
s;Juliet;Well, while you go talk to Morrissey, I'll poke around the castle.
s;Juliet;Let me know what he says!
s;Luther;Vincent, let's wait here while Lord Verstadt speaks to Lord Morrissey.
s;Simon;This negotiation business was always my least favorite part of the job...
